results.name: Triangle T(n, k, q) = binomial(n, k) + q^n*binomial(n-2, k-1) - 1 with T(n, 0) = T(n, n) = 1 and q = 3, read by rows.
comment: The triangle sequences having the form T(n,k,q) = binomial(n, k) + q^n*binomial(n-2, k-1) - 1 have the row sums Sum_{k=0..n} T(n,k,q) = 2^(n-2)*q^n + 2^n - (n-1) - (5/4)*[n=0] -(q/2)*[n=1]. - _G. C. Greubel_, Feb 16 2021
link: G. C. Greubel, Rows n = 0..100 of the triangle, flattened
formula: T(n, k, q) = binomial(n, k) + q^n*binomial(n-2, k-1) - 1 with T(n, 0) = T(n, n) = 1 and q = 3.
mathematica: T[n_, k_, q_]:= If[k==0 || k==n, 1, Binomial[n, k] +(q^n)*Binomial[n-2, k-1] -1];
Table[T[n,k,3], {n,0,12}, {k,0,n}]//Flatten (* modified by _G. C. Greubel_, Feb 16 2021 *)
program: def T(n,k,q): return 1 if (k==0 or k==n) else binomial(n,k) + q^n*binomial(n-2,k-1) -1
flatten([[T(n,k,3) for k in (0..n)] for n in (0..12)]) # _G. C. Greubel_, Feb 16 2021
T:= func< n,k,q | k eq 0 or k eq n select 1 else Binomial(n,k) + q^n*Binomial(n-2,k-1) -1 >;
